title: Can we talk about mage "supports"?

> [{quoted}](name=LordGeovanni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UmIyMv2i,comment-id=0001000100000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-12-17T16:57:54.720+0000)

I actually don't think {{champion:37}} is in a bad place at all.  She has a few semi-weak early levels and high mana costs as currently tuned, and I think that is fair because if you get her an early {{item:3003}} she is one of the hardest-scaling late game supports in the game.  

I am M6 working on M7 with her, and to me it often feels unfair to the enemy team when I am {{champion:37}} on a large lead.  All of her spells are good and her cooldowns are insanely low.  All of her damage is 100% guaranteed within its range, on point-and-click autoattacks or a literal press-one-button spell with no skillshots required on a spammable 3-second late-game cooldown.  She has a major two-champion heal that gives a spammable team shield on a 4-second late game cooldown.  She has escapability through a major movespeed buff on 6-second late game cooldown.  She has an ultimate that's a team stun once per minute late game.  And her technicals are not difficult as League mechanics go - any champion is a difficult pilot at a high skill level, but  {{champion:37}} isn't exactly {{champion:142}}, she's a one-difficulty champ who was designed as a forgiving support for newer players.

So I think if she weren't as weak early as she is she'd be absolutely oppressive, because she's pretty oppressive now when played correctly.

Her natural late-game formation is the deathball, and it would be really neat to see some pro teams take a chance on her with some of the {{champion:145}}/{{champion:110}}-style late game deathball comps that were popular mid-Season 8 in some scrims or early matches in Season 9.
